title: Manchester United transfer news: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer urged to move for 'generational talent' Sandro Tonali
text:
Sandro Tonali is highly-rated (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United’s Italian scouts have urged the club to sanction a move for Brescia teenager Sandro Tonali.

The 19-year-old is one of the most highly-rated midfielders in Europe and has already made 61 Serie A appearances for Brescia.

Solskjaer has lost Ander Herrera and Marouane Fellaini since joining the club and has made no secret of his desire to strengthen in midfield.

Paul Pogba is likely to leave the club next summer and United have tasked their scouts with finding a replacement for the Frenchman.

United have watched Tonali over the last two seasons (Picture: Getty)

And United’s Italy-based scouting network believe they’ve found a solution in Tonali, according to the Sun.

The teenager broke into the first team two years ago and United have kept a close eye on him ever since.

However, the improvements he’s shown in 2019 have alerted a wealth of other top clubs and United’s scouts have reported back that the Red Devils need to speed up a move for the midfielder if they stand any chance of landing him.

The deep-lying playmaker has drawn comparisons with Andrea Pirlo and Jorginho for his ability to build up play from the base of midfield but he’s slowly adding goals to his game and has netted six times for the club.

Tonali was recently handed his first international call-up and though suitors hope to sign him for around £40m, it could take a far bigger fee to extract him from Brescia.
